<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Draconic Sycophant](/Feats.aspx?ID=2380) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Kobold" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=224" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Ancestry Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=74) pg. 37 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

You have an affect that dragonkind find unusually pleasing—and when that fails, you know when to duck. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks and saving throws against [dragons](/Traits.aspx?ID=50). In addition, whenever you meet a creature with the dragon trait in a social situation, you can attempt a [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) check to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) on that creature immediately, rather than after conversing for 1 minute; you take a –5 penalty to this check. If you fail, you can choose to engage in 1 minute of conversation and then attempt a new check rather than accept the failure or critical failure result.

**Special** If you have the [Glad-Hand](/Feats.aspx?ID=787) skill feat, you don't take the penalty to your immediate Diplomacy check if the target has the dragon trait.
name: Draconic Sycophant
